Helper function to apply a Butterworth filter to an xarray object.

Helper function to apply a gradient to an xarray object.

Helper function to apply a Savitzky-Golay filter to an xarray object.

mpim_icelab.harps.light_harps.read_light_harps(file: str) → Dataset[source]

Reads a log file of a light harp designed by Leif Riemenschneider. The log file is in tabular form of the format:

idx s:d:a: time C R G B logger_temperature

idx : integer index keeping track of continuous measurements
s   : stick
d   : diode
a   : amplifier
C   : clear channel
R   : red channel
G   : green channel
B   : blue channel

Data get converted into an xarray.Dataset.

class mpim_icelab.harps.salinity_harps.SalinityHarpsAccessor(xarray_obj)[source]

Bases: object

A xarray accessor for calculating sea-ice properties by hands of the data from the salinity harps.

calc_ice_properties(**kwargs)[source]

Calculates, based on the data provided by the salinity harps, certain properties of sea ice. I.e., the salinity of brine, the bulk salinity as well as the solid and liquid fraction.

Parameters

  • resistance_channel (str) – One of the channels of the salinity harp recording the resistance (i.e. either ‘r16’ [default] or ‘r10’ for the current versions of the harps; state: November 2020)

  • r_tol (float) – The tolerance threshold given as float. This threshold gives the value at which the gradient of the resistance signal has first reached a critical threshold. This is associated with the freezing onset since the resistance rises once ice is forming.

  • brine_sal_method (str) – Determines the method according to which the salinity of brine is computed (see also the doc string of the function calc_brine_salinity). Currently this can be one of the following: ‘Assur’, ‘N&W09’, or ‘Vancoppenolle’.

Returns

ds – The original xarray dataset but extended by the computed quantities, i.e. salinity of brine, the bulk salinity as well as the solid and liquid fraction.

Return type

xarray.Dataset

mpim_icelab.harps.salinity_harps.calc_brine_salinity(T: float, method='Assur', print_formula=False)[source]

Calculate the brine salinity by a given temperature according to one of the following methods: - ‘Assur’

year: 1958 S = -1.20 - 21.8*T - 0.919*T**2 - 0.0178*T**3

  • ‘N&W09’

    author: Notz & Worster year: 2009 S = -21.4*T - 0.886*T**2 - 0.0170*T**3

  • ‘Vancoppenolle’

    year: 2019 doi: 10.1029/2018JC014611 S = -18.7*T - 0.519*T**2 - 0.00535*T**3

Parameters

  • T (float) – Temperature in °C

  • method (str, optional) – The method according to which the brine salinity is calculated. Must be one of the above mentioned.

    Default: 'Assur'

  • print_formula (bool, optional) – If true, prints the polynomial of the respective method

    Default: False

mpim_icelab.harps.salinity_harps.calc_freezing_starts(data: Dataset, resistance_channel='r16', kind='median', tolerance=0.0001) → Dataset[source]

Computing the freeze onsets.

Parameters

  • data (xarray.Dataset) – The xarray dataset generated from the log files of the salinity harps.

  • resistance_channel (str, optional) – The channel of the resistance values on which the calculation shall be based (currently, one out of ‘r16’ or ‘r10’; state: November 2020)

    Default: 'r16'

  • kind (str, optional) – For being able to compute a gradient of the input data that can be used for determining the freeze onset, the input data need to be smoothed. This is done by a function that is given by kind and can be one out of the following: median [default], savgol

    Default: 'median'

  • tolerance (float, optional) – The tolerance threshold given as float. This threshold gives the value at which the gradient of the resistance signal has first reached a critical threshold. This is associated with the freezing onset since the resistance rises once ice is forming.

    Default: 0.0001

Return type

The time coordinate of the input xarray.Dataset

mpim_icelab.harps.salinity_harps.populate_attrs(ds, attrs_dict)[source]
mpim_icelab.harps.salinity_harps.read_salinity_harps(file: str, **kwargs) → Dataset[source]

Read-out routine for log files of the salinity harps developed by Leif Riemenschneider. Non-valid characters get eliminated such that only numeric values remain. An xarray.Dataset is created with time, module and wire_pair as coordinates.

Returns

ds – Converted pandas.DataFrame to xarray.Dataset. Similar to netCDF structure.

Return type

xarray.Dataset
